description: Writes a message to a log file.
name: log

application.description: Specifies whether to log the application name if one has been specified in a cfapplication tag.

time.description: This attribute has been deprecated and is non-functional.

file.description:
Message file. Specify only the main part of the filename.
            For example, to log to the Testing.log file, specify
            "Testing".

            The file must be located in the default log directory. You
            cannot specify a directory path. If the file does not
            exist, it is created automatically, with the suffix .log.

thread.description: This attribute has been deprecated and is non-functional.

charset.description: Character set name for the file contents.

date.description: This attribute has been deprecated and is non-functional.

type.description:
Type (severity) of the message:
- information (default)
- warning
- error
- fatal

log.description:
If you omit the file attribute, specifies the standard log file in which to write the message.
		Ignored if you specify a file attribute
